ANDS-Grants.description: This grant tests a new approach to childhood obesity prevention which provides a way for all members of a community to play a role in improving the health of children.
ANDS-Grants.title: Whole of Systems Trial of Prevention Strategies for childhood obesity: WHO STOPS childhood obesity
funder: National Health and Medical Research Council
subjects: population health | health promotion | obesity | public health | cost-effectiveness

ANDS-Grants.description: This grant tests a new approach to childhood obesity prevention which provides a way for all members of a community to play a role in improving the health of children.
ANDS-Grants.title: Whole of Systems Trial of Prevention Strategies for childhood obesity: WHO STOPS childhood obesity
funder: National Health and Medical Research Council

ANDS-Grants.description: We will assess the effectiveness of a new approach to community-wide childhood obesity prevention. We will work with partners to improve the health of children from birth to 12 years in the Ovens Murray and Goulburn region of Victoria. We will work with 10 Local Government Authorities, 14 health services and 116 schools, reaching more than 30,000 children.
ANDS-Grants.title: RESPOND: Reflexive Evidence and Systems Interventions to Prevent Obesity and Non-Communicable Disease
funder: National Health and Medical Research Council
subjects: obesity | child health | prevention | epidemiology | randomised controlled trial (rct)

ANDS-Grants.description: Despite healthy school canteen policies being mandated by many jurisdictions in Australia and internationally, uptake has been limited. This study will assess the effectiveness of an intervention in increasing canteen practices consistent with the NSW Government healthy canteen policy. The study will randomise 70 primary schools to a 12 month intervention, or a no intervention comparison group. The intervention includes; executive support, training, resources, monitoring-feedback, communication strategies and ongoing support. Canteen menus will be audited to assess the proportion of schools which i) sell foods or beverages restricted under the policy; ii) have majority (>50%) of healthy items. This will be the first RCT of its kind.
ANDS-Grants.title: Linkage Projects - Grant ID: LP130101008

ANDS-Grants.description: This CRE aims to build a world-leading, multi-disciplinary research team that aims to have a real impact on finding and implementing policy solutions to the global obesity epidemic. It will support policy makers and public health advocates to create potent and sustained policy change by evaluating potential policy options and their impacts on environments and systems, enhancing policy development and implementation processes, and monitoring the actions of the public and private sectors.
ANDS-Grants.title: Policy Research on Obesity and Food Systems
funder: National Health and Medical Research Council
subjects: obesity | food | health economics | cost-effectiveness | population health | preventive health | policy evaluation | nutrition | health promotion | health policy
